p: The IFN response seems to be contributing simultaneously to the protection against viruses and to the pathology induced by the same viral infections. Human pDCs demonstrate a robust IFN-I production after MERS-CoV infection, especially IFN- α, and this response is greater than that elicited by SARS-CoV [ 147]. High IFN- α and IFN- γ have been associated with early SARS-CoV sequelae suggesting that unregulated IFN responses during acute-phase SARS-CoV may be deleterious for this infection [ 148].
